title: Changes in Adult Education Systems and Digital Technology-Based Learning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Course where adults experience new learning methods in response to educational system changes, conducted in offline environments with provided digital devices (tablets, laptops)

learning_goals: Learners can compare and explain traditional formats of adult education systems with new formats based on digital technologies
Learners can establish self-directed learning plans utilizing digital platforms (online lectures, mobile learning apps)

In a hybrid learning model (online: Zoom, offline: workshop integration), learners perform team projects (3–4 members) using collaboration tools like Notion, Slack, and Miro, submit project deliverables (proposal, prototype) on time, and achieve an average of 4/5 points or higher in peer evaluations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
